numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A student can have legacy status.
2. A student can have no legacy status.
3. I have seen a trend about admissions.
4. If a student has no legacy status then the chance of admission is lower when the parents of the student make more money.
5. If a student has no legacy status and the student is among the top 0.1% then the chance of admission is not lower when the parents of the student make more money.
6. Students with legacy status do not fully follow this trend.
7. For a student with legacy status, the admission rate often rises with the income of the parents of the student.
8. If a student is among the top 0.1% then the chance of admission is nearly doubled.
9. I wonder why the admissions process to Ivy League colleges is so competitive.
10. For Ivy League colleges, the likelihood of acceptance increases dramatically with income.
11. I believe that elite universities want wealthy students.
12. I believe that wealthy parents will pay a lot of money to elite universities.
13. I believe that wealthy parents pay money to get their children admitted.
14. I believe that some children are inferior.
15. I believe that Ivy League schools are esteemed institutions.
16. I believe that institutions have a right to raise tuition.
17. I believe that institutions have a right to elevate their status.
18. I believe that this happens when so-called elites enroll in Ivy League schools.
19. This topic is relevant to my town.
20. Many individuals in my town prepare to enter college.
21. Admissions decisions can take this topic into account.
22. If admissions decisions take this topic into account then issues with college admission might occur in my town.
23. The headline is: Dear College Am I Rich Enough For You.
